```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
```

## Lets simulate something..

I have functions

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(sample_size, mu = 3, sigma = 4) {
  
  sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n = sample_size, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  )

  sim_data %>% 
    summarise(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd = sd(x)
    )

}
```

I can "simulate" by running this line.

```{r}
sim_mean_sd(30)
```

## Lets simulate a lot

Lets start a `for` loop

```{r}
output = vector("list", length = 100)

for (i in 1:100) {
  
  output[[i]] = sim_mean_sd(sample_size = 30)
  
}

bind_rows(output)
```

Lets use a loop function.

```{r}
?rerun()

sim_results = 
  rerun(5000, sim_mean_sd(sample_size = 30)) %>% 
  bind_rows()
```

Lets look at results .. 

```{r}
sim_results %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = mean)) + geom_density()

sim_results %>% 
  summarise(
    avg_samp_mean = mean(mean),
    sd_samp_mean = sd(mean)
  )

sim_results %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = sd)) +geom_density()
```
